name: Martinhal Beach Resort & Hotel

reviews.text: It is the third time in a row at martinhal in the ocean view house. Still looking good - the place is still in excellent condition. Great beach, great pools. Lovely setting.
reviews.title: Third time -still good
Second visit as good as the first, will book a third
reviews.text: Need to add a bit of intrigue to the restaurants. Get some of that local feel ?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ants in house 230. Avoid it
reviews.title: Excellent for Families

reviews.text: We recently returned from a great visit to martinhal (our second). Our kids (2 and 4) were in heaven and frankly so were we. We stayed in a partial Ocean view apartment and it was great. Really wel appointed, very clean and the provision of baby/toddler apparel perfect. It was great to see how the resort had 'evolved, and responded to fedback.
reviews.title: Clapham sur la mer

reviews.text: Our only gripe with the hotel was some of the restaurant staff. We were there last week before high season and you could tell. Many staff were just starting and learning the ropes - service was often very slow, wrong and at one point we had to walk out of a restaurant as despite 2 reminders we still had not had been able to place an order.
reviews.title: A great early summer break
High end holiday for adults and it's great for kids too.
reviews.text: We took our 2 year old to Martinhal in June this year and stayed in an Ocean View house.

reviews.title: Best in the region, but.......
reviews.text: The house was amazing. The bedrooms are down stairs with 2 bathrooms. Upstairs is the living room and kitchen with dining table and a balcony with a great view. We loved the decor and the furnature. The kitchen was well equipt with everything we needed to self cater.

reviews.title: perfect family holiday
reviews.text: The bedrooms were roomy and the beds were the most comfortable I have slept in.

reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel
reviews.text: The resort itself is fantastic. Loads to do for children. To say its child friendly is an under statement. It's all about them but it still feels like an adult holiday too. We really felt we had the best of both worlds. I'm not a pool lover, but I really enjoyed the pools at Martinhal. Indoors or outdoors depending on how you feel! I loved the beanbags to sit on and the friendly poolside staff.

reviews.title: Our second very nice experience at Martinhal.
reviews.text: The places to eat were great. We tried all of them. The food was beautiful and again the staff made our little boy very welcome. He got taken to meet the Chef after dinner one night! He loved it.

Martinhal Beach Resort in Sagres, Portugal is incredibly accommodating for families with small children. "Five Star" luxury is no empty promise there. From the moment we arrived until we drove away, the staff were overwhelmingly helpful and competent. No problem is unsolvable, in fact, I don't believe I ever heard a "no" in response to any request, during our entire stay.
reviews.title: Families More Than Welcome!

reviews.text: Just back from a weeks holiday here with our 3yr old and 1yr old. We had a beach front villa which was very well equipped and any baby requirements we need were meet such as door stops and stair gates. The house is 'upside down' with the bedrooms downstairs which mDe me slightly uneasy leaving the kids in bed on there own but overall the accommodation was excellent. This is really a resort for young families and all the restaurants have activities such as playgrounds and trampolines to keep children entertained as you dine. As everyone is in the same boat you do not feel uncomfortable if your child cries at dinner or goes up tp another table-people are so friendly. The wind was gentle first week of September but staff did mention that it was very strong in July/august. Ate in all restaurants. The Dunas fish restaurant was the best. The Otis Ian in the plaza was nice-great location for kids to play as you ate. Pool bar was slightly limited on food. The fine dining Terraco was nice but food was not 'fine dining' standardmin my opinion! Overall I would highly recommend this resort for families with children up to about the age of eight. Thanks Matinhal for a relaxing family getaway!
reviews.title: Amazing family resort

reviews.text: We visited this resort in July with our son, his wife and grandson aged 21 months. What a lovely relaxed holiday, with plenty of walks, a lovely beach and great food. We particularly liked the relaxed atmosphere of the hotel, the staff were all professional and friendly, all most attentive to our requirements. WE loved the Family breakfast room where the children can draw, paint play at the play table with supervised staff. My grandson loved the interaction with the other children and the staff after he had eaten his brekfast and left us to watch him and enjoy another coffee or two. First time I have ever come across this delightful idea in a hotel. well done Martinhall a great facility. The Italian restaurant in the square was another favourite and great for kiddies too. Lots of playthings to entertain them in the square with some themed nights with bouncy castles, face painting and organised games, what a great area with some shops and the site small supermarket which is great for everyday needs. Excellent choice of accommodation, we had 2 x part sea view rooms which were both excellent, contained all requirements with a good sized bathroom with separate shower cubicle. Rooms are cleaned very well. Good sized balcony and terrace, we had the latter which was by the side of the well kept garden. The fish restaurant is superb with stunning views over the bay, however our favourite was the restaurant in the hotel, the staff were all excellent and very friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: Great Family Resort!!!!

reviews.text: THe only draw back was the 1 hour 15 minutes transfer from the airport, do take a drink especially for the kiddies, leave the high heels at home, you don't need them on the cobbles and stone floors. We would certainly return to this very relaxed family resort. Highly recommended for families!!!!
reviews.title: Fabulous ignore any negative reviews re weather /wind.

reviews.text: Amazing stay again couldn't fault anything.there could be a little more going on of an evening say up to about 10.30 and for teens too . This is the nicest side of Portugal and all the local beaches in the area are fantastic as visited quite a few in the area.
reviews.title: Sunny, Special and Superb in Sagres!

reviews.text: Martinhal Beach Resort and Hotel is a great seaside resort which is only a short drive from the centre of Sagres. We ate at the resort's As Dunas restaurant on our first night which we enjoyed and then had a very comfortable night in our Bay Villa, which overlooked a stunning bay which is just around the corner from Martinhal beach. Martinhal beach is clean and pleasant, and while sometimes a bit windy, for the duration of our stay, it was warm and settled. The kayaking form the beach was great fun, and we were able to paddle round to quite and secluded bays and beaches, and rocky outcrops which were teeming with wildlife. We played tennis twice, and also had a go at Padel tennis, which is great fun. The facilities were all very good, and were very close to our accommodation. There were a few ants in our room and one of the doors did not lock properly, but both of these issues were quickly put right my maintenance. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the resort, and our looking forward to returning next year.
reviews.title: Wonderful ocean house
Does not live up to it's 5 stars
reviews.text: We had a lovely 2 week holiday with our 11 and 14 year old children, staying in an ocean house. We thought the house was fantastic. It was very spacious, wonderful views, well equipped kitchen, we loved the Nespresso machine, iPod dock, Fatboy on the terrace, etc. The beds were so comfortable, and it was lovely to see the ocean from our bed.

The kids very much enjoyed hanging out in the Blue Room which is very well equipped for teenagers, and we also enjoyed watching the closing ceremony of the Olympics in there, on a large screen. We found the whole complex very clean, and all the staff friendly. It certainly did not feel like it was overrun with toddlers, as some other reviewers have suggested, and we were not affected at all by any wind. We loved how large the whole complex was, giving our kids plenty of space to roam around, yet within the safety of the hotel grounds. The kids also loved the trampoline.
reviews.title: Great houses

reviews.text: We ate at each of the restaurants but were disappointed by them. Although the variety and quality of food available at breakfast was excellent, the service totally let it down. It could take between 5 and 40 minutes for coffee to arrive, and hot food (available on request) was also very haphazard, and so we'd often almost finished our breakfast before our americanos arrived. We felt that the service let down the fine dining restaurant too. We also thought the prices at all 3 restaurants were extremely high, and only visited each one once, preferring to eat at the nearby beach restaurant or in Sagres or Lagos, where the value was far better. We'd recommend eating at Notrada (we went at least 4 times, the kids loved running around on the sand-dune outside), Warung (very chilled, and good for vegetarian food), Mums (also good for vegetarians), D'Italia (very good pizza pasta restaurant).
reviews.title: What a great place.

reviews.text: We spent a lovely week in August at one of the ocean view villas - super view from balcony. The villa is probably the best set up that I have ever experienced. Super kitchen and bedrooms - the resort is fat boy bean bag based so don't expert too many sun loungers. They are even on your balcony - v relaxing.
reviews.title: Lovely weeks family holiday

reviews.text: Our kids 10,8 and 6 yrs are not wild on kids clubs but there is a good one there. This is very definitely a family resort in July and August so would not reccomend it if you don't have kids at that time of yr.
reviews.title: A luxurious, welcoming and child-friendly resort

reviews.text: There are 3 restaurants in the development and they are not cheap and I would rate the food as good but not amazing. The Italian in the village square is handy to eat with the kids but not a real adults venue. There are 2 beach bars and one is excellent ( the one nearer sagres end of beach) the other was pretty awful and service dire.
reviews.title: I almost don't want to tell you how good this place is

reviews.text: We ended up eating there a lot as for a week you would rather not bother going to main shops to get food to cook. However be warned - as with most resorts the mini market is astonomically priced. I really don't know why they have to do this - dont mind paying a premium but not getting ripped off.
reviews.title: Fabulous luxury child friendly resort

reviews.text: The clothes shop there is also crazy prices. Definitely an option for something more affordable. Either way we would return for a week but any longer and you would need a car to escape to other locations for a break.
reviews.title: Excellent resort for families with small children - ticked all the boxes.

reviews.text: We stayed at Martinhal this year for the second time with our son (now 2 years old) and I have to say the resort has become even better since our first visit in 2012. This time we stayed in an Ocean villa which had an amazing view and was close to all the resort facilities / pools etc... The villa was really child friendly and well laid out, and most importantly the balcony was really sheltered from the wind so was pleasant to sit out on in the evenings.
reviews.title: Even better in 2013

reviews.text: There have been quite a few changes since 2012 which have really improved the resort further:
reviews.title: Still great but prices getting silly

reviews.text: - The new surf bar in the village square has livened up this area a lot and is a really nice environment with inside and outside space and an interconnecting door to the kids club play area as well as being right beside the main play area in the square. There is an old VW camper van in the bar area that is great for the kids to climb in and play driver!
reviews.title: Great holiday

reviews.text: - The supermarket is now larger and better stocked than before. Yes, it is more expensive than supermarkets in Sagres, but they do carry a lot of really useful items for children that you may not find easily in other local supermarkets such as Aptamil / Ella's Kitchen / fresh non UHT milk etc...
reviews.title: Everything we could have hoped for our baby's first holiday

reviews.text: - There has clearly been a lot of investment in the children's play areas including a new playground area by the main pool near the village, lots more play equipment in the main village square area and an extended sandpit by the As Dunas restaurant with new equipment.
reviews.title: So comfortable

reviews.text: We are just back from Martinhal and had yet another great family holiday in an ocean view house. The accommodation, the staff and the activities were first class.
reviews.title: Great stay in a fantastic family friendly hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a huge range of activities on offer both free and for a small fee and you are told about the activities in a Daily newssheet delivered to your house each day.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: The activities for children and adults alike reflected the Olympics theme for the first week and our two children enjoyed in particular the kids triathlon, the kayaking, the pool games, the paddle tennis and the evening football games which the staff organised.We also did some surfing on the beaches just a short drive away and explored the national park that the hotel overlooks in the wonderful cliff walks.
reviews.title: Almost perfection but read more...

reviews.text: We ate both in the hotel restaurants As Dunas and the Italian on the village square both pf which were very goodand also in the local town Sagres which is just a short drive away. The local barefoot beach bar and restaurant Nortada and The Best Burger Ever were particularly good options. The kitchen is very well equipped too though and we cooked in on several evenings and enjoy the sea views.
reviews.title: Summer holiday

reviews.text: We stayed at Martinhal for several days in April as a part of my birthday trip. All we can say - it was one of the best hotel we've ever stayed at.
reviews.title: Outstanding resort, wind is a bonus!
Lovely Holiday but could be so much better..
reviews.text: we are just back from a week in martinhal, our second visit. We stayed in an ocean view house which was beautifully decorated and clean and well equipped. We were with our 2 and 4 year old daughters and they loved every minute of it and were never bored with all that was on offer for them. My only gripe is that the food in the restaurants, particularly the Italian in the square, was NOT good and overpriced. I would nearly go as far as to say it didnt seem that the food was cooked fresh on site...there was something distinctly manufactured about it...I could be wrong but it certainly was not up to scratch. Service, while friendly, was not good..staff seemed very in experienced and overwhelmed at times. we went into Sagres and ate in Mums and Villa Velha a few times and the food was excellent and far better value for money. we also had our lunch most days down at the beach restaurants. they are quiet and simple but food and service was far better. Also, i was shocked at the price of the sunbeds on the beach..agree with other reviewers it is not normal for a 5 star hotel to charge. I also agree that the village shop is overpriced. We will go back but will go to other beaches and restaurants.

reviews.title: June trip
reviews.text: We booked as a result of the favourable publicity in the press. It is a nice hotel and resort but we didn't find it quite as good as we had read. It has the feel of Bedruthan Steps about it, which is a complement, and by that I mean it is well suited to families with children of pre-school age- or slightly older. The facilities, notably the restaurants, seem to cater very well for this category.

reviews.title: Wow!
reviews.text: We stayed in a villa which was very well equipped, clean and quiet. The only negative was that the pool wasn't heated which rendered it unusable in early June. The resort staff were great, always accommodating and willing to help.

reviews.title: The Perfect Resort for Families with Young Children
reviews.text: The hotel is located at the western end of the Algarve which gives it a different feel than the more mainstream part of the coast, which we found refreshing..... although visitors should be prepared for the strong winds.

reviews.title: Excellent icing to our holiday in Portugal
reviews.text: We were very disappointed with the quality of the restaurants- we had a dreadful meal at the Terrace restaurant on our first night - (food- service and value) and an awful take-away pizza from the italian on the second night. We'd recommend making the short journey into Sagres and trying some of the local restaurants which were excellent. The on-site supermarket is very expensive, again a 5 minute drive to Sagres finds you in a well stocked Intermarche.

We stayed here with our 18 month old in September for 1 week in a Garden Villa. Everything in the villa has been thought of with children in mind - from child friendly furniture with no sharp edges to a selection of children's channels on the TV. The hotel helpfully emailed the week before we arrived and asked us to complete a simple form requesting additional items such as child gates, high chair, travel cot etc... It was also possible to get other items for younger babies such as bottle warmer / steriliser etc... Everything we requested was there for us on arrival. The villa was very well laid out with modern, tasteful decoration, fully functioning kitchen and A/C throughout. The exterior terrace and access to garden also provided a safe area for our little one to play. More could be made of the roof terrace though - perhaps some furniture / awning etc... as currently there was nothing up there and the space is not made the most of.
reviews.title: Brilliant for kids - and adult friendly too!

reviews.text: We did self catering and everything you need food and drink wise is available in the on site shop "O Mercado" including very helpfully UK brands of baby formula (Aptamil) and food (Ella's Kitchen, Organix). We tended to have breakfast and lunch in our villa and eat out at one of the 3 hotel restaurants in the evenings. The "Oz Gambosinos" and "As Dunas" restaurants are extremely child friendly even after dark with plenty of kids choices on the menu and play areas right by where you can keep an eye on them once they are finished eating and want to be on the move! Even the fine dining restaurant in the main hotel called "O Terraco" caters for kids up to 7:30pm where some of the kids club staff are on hand to entertain kids on the adjoining breakfast terrace while we could enjoy finishing our meal. If you were not travelling with children, O Terraco restaurant and bar turns into a child free haven after this time so you can have some tranquillity and relaxation ;-)
reviews.title: 5* family resort - one of the best in Europe - highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the pool areas in the hotel are well maintained and child friendly. The Rasponinhos kids club was perfect for our toddler and he didn't want to leave!
reviews.title: A real treat

reviews.text: All in all, this is an excellent resort for families with kids of all ages, and the thought put into every last detail to make the trip easier and as hassle free as possible is amazing. If you are travelling as a couple, there are also enough quiet areas around the resort and options for adult dining and relaxation (e.g. Finesterra Spa) that you won't feel you are surrounded by kids all the time!
reviews.title: Great Setting, Great Facilities, Good Food, Shame about the restaurant service

reviews.text: We (parents, 3 kids 5-10 yrs old) had a fabulous three weeks. Extremely attentive service and staff - very personal and aimed at making the customer feel special and pampered. Nice restaurants and excellent deli, wifi everywhere for today's connected families and allowing friends and grandparents to "be there". The many activities and sports are extremely well organised and are great for every family member. Try the surfing, tennis, cycling or sailing....or just have ice cream by the pool. The villas are real houses: very large, modern and luxurious - with hotel service and take home dining so hassle free. Despite the resort being quite large, it feels very intimate and cosy with many guests returning for several years or owning/time sharing a villa. What would make it even better? No sure....lunch served at all the pools maybe?
reviews.title: Unbelievably good

reviews.text: i cannot recommend this resort enough. We actually spent a lot of time trying to find something wrong!
reviews.title: incredible

reviews.text: we stayed in a bay house and if only my house was as beautifully designed, high quality and spotless! nespresso machines in kitchen, flat screen TV (never used) white goods, two fridges one just for beer! good quality well stocked utensils. patio doors both sides that open fully and insect doors, black out blinds.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: The design, the lighting, even down to the door handles has been carefully selected and and no expense spared. Beds, mattresses, pillows, bedding were amazing, the bath and shower efficient and well designed. Wonderful good quality NOYA beauty products left in the rooms that we treasured.We worked out it was shop price of £80's worth per house. The giant outdoor bean bags were a top hit too.
reviews.title: Perfect holiday for families

reviews.text: The cleaning fairies came every day and did an exceptional job.
reviews.title: Excellent for toddlers

reviews.text: Everywhere we strolled our breath was taken away, the amount of care that had gone into it. The gardens, the architecture, the soft furnishings and lighting, design themes and contrasts. One day we found a path we hadn't seen before to find a little clearing in the edge of the beach, a box of beach toys supplied, a pod, a hammock and some hanging chairs hidden away in a little wooded area, totally secluded and blissful with untouched views and not so many kids. Such a pleasant surprise.
reviews.title: Fantastic family Holiday

description: Martinhal Beach Resort & Hotel is the finest luxury family resort in Europe. Positioned within a protected natural park near the historic fishing port of Sagres, on Portugal’s unspoiled western Algarve coast, Martinhal is where luxury meets Nature. Martinhal welcomes families and couples, and the greeting is warm, open and generous. Guests feel at home. And it’s memorable. This is where life-long friendships will blossom, and where lasting impressions will be made. Stylish, contemporary architecture complements the organic personality of the resort, which has been shaped to blend effortlessly into the indigenous landscape. This is function and form at its best. This is sustainability. And Martinhal is more. For conferences, weddings and celebrations, Europe’s finest luxury resort sets the scene.
